Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting by looking at the data, all events are from Machine M1 over a 10-minute span (from 08:00:00 to 08:01:10). Let me list out the events and see how the parameters change over time. These seem like initial conditions, maybe the machine is starting up but not active yet. The low or zero values in flow, vibration, and tool position suggest it's in a standby or idle phase.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Then event 4 jumps to temperature 50째C, pressure 1.5, vibration 30Hz, material flow 5, tool position 5, energy 2.00. That's a big spike in temperature, vibration, and flow. Events 4-6 continue with increasing temperature (505558), vibration up to 38Hz, flow rate increasing to 38, tool position moving to 10mm. Energy consumption is rising each time.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So with corrected Material Flow: Events4-6: Temp 50-58, vibration 30-38, flow 5, tool moving from 5 to 10mm. This is a sustained cutting phase with increasing temperature and vibration, but material flow stays constant. Then event7-8: Temp drops to 40, vibration drops to 10, flow drops to 2, tool stays at 15. Pressure increases to 2. Maybe this is a setup phase. Event9: Sudden spike in all parameters except pressure. Temp 80, vibration 50, flow 50. This is a new phase. The high flow suggests a lot of material moving, high temp and vibration. Maybe this is welding. Then events10-12: After event9, the parameters drop. Temp goes to 30, then 25, vibration drops to 1-5, flow to 1 then 5, tool moves to 20mm. Maybe assembling parts here. Name: Validation - PE
Text: For Cutting (events4-6): Temp increases from 50 to 58, vibration increases, tool moves further. This is consistent with cutting where the tool is moving through the material, with friction causing temp and vibration. Material flow is steady, so the material is being fed at a constant rate. Welding (event9): Sudden spike in temperature (80째C), vibration (50 Hz), material flow (50 units/s), and energy (5kWh) suggest a high-energy process like welding, possibly with rapid material movement and intense thermal activity. Assembling (events10-12): Lower vibration (1-5 Hz), moderate temperature (25-30째C), fluctuating material flow (1 to 5 units/s), and tool repositioning (to 20mm) indicate parts being adjusted or joined with less forceful movements compared to cutting or welding. The remaining events (1-3,7-8,13) are either setup/idle or transitions between phases and thus not labeled as main activities.
